snippet: The Santa Fe Pacific Corporation said yesterday that it was selling 340 miles of rail lines to public transportation agencies in Southern California for $500 million. The sale is part of an effort to build a commuter line stretching from Los Angel...
lead_paragraph: The Santa Fe Pacific Corporation said yesterday that it was selling 340 miles of rail lines to public transportation agencies in Southern California for $500 million. The sale is part of an effort to build a commuter line stretching from Los Angeles to San Bernardino and from Los Angeles to San Diego, a Santa Fe spokeswoman said. Both freight and commuter lines will run on the tracks.

headline.main: SANTA FE PACIFIC WILL SELL SOME CALIFORNIA LINES
